fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-42998].
  {panel}

When a page that has both inline and regular comments appears in a recommended updates email, all of the comments (page, inline and replies) will be counted.

Say you had the following:
# 1 comment at the base of a page
# 2 resolved inline comments
# 2 replies to one of the inline comments

That's technically 5 comments - however you cannot see 4 of them straight off the bat, because those comments are inline (and resolved). Should we say that this page in question has one comment, or five? (We currently say 5)
fields.summary: The recommended updates email should not include inline and resolved inline comments, when producing a count of comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-42994].
  {panel}

*Steps to replicate*
# Create a new Confluence page
# Insert a table with at least two cells
# Select two or more cells by dragging with the mouse
# Set a background color
# Click on Preview or Save
# The cells will still appear white

This issue does not occur when you tint the cells one by one. It also affects just the last modification before saving. For instance, if you tint two cells in row A and two cells in row B afterwards, only the colors for row B won't be saved.
fields.summary: Table cell background color does not get saved when selecting multiple cells

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-42993].
  {panel}

This is very similar to the suggestion - CONF-2803 - that was already added as a feature.

I would like the ability to select whether an entire section (no matter the column layout) is expandable/collapsible when "Page Layout" section selections are used.

See attached screenshot for placement - could be a checkbox with text "Make Section Expandable?" to enable/disable section behavior.

DISCUSSION:
The page layout section/column feature works really well for keeping the 'Edit View' of a page organized, and for simple PDF export formatting.  However, on long pages with many separate sections, and multiple section column-layout variations there is no way to expand and collapse one entire (say, 2 or 3-column) section itself.

To get the same effect, the Expand macro would need to be added to a 'single-column section', encapsulating multiple Column macros each containing the panels (or content) that would naturally display in separate sections (in the 'Edit' page view).

This becomes important when it would be helpful to collapse (multi-column) sections when viewing a page - but also retain the same visual layout where many team members also are editing content on that page.  The whole Expand, Column, Panel/Content formatting makes the Edit view a mess and difficult for some to easily locate content they need to edit!
fields.summary: Selectbox to allow for expand/collapse of a SECTION when added by "Page Layout"
Make Date header of Confluence Roadmap Planner macro sticky

fields.description:
We would like to reach anchors in other pages. This does not work if there are square brackets in tho other page's name.
I.e., something like:
DocumentName[Group]#Anchorname
*is not recognized as a link* in Confluence.

It will also not work when the complete URL is used, for instance:  
https://ourconfluence.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=123456789#DocumentName[Group]#Anchorname
or
https://ourconfluence.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=123456789#DocumentName[Group]-header
to reach a titled section.

We tried different variants. Strange thing is, that I could realize this with exactly one example but it is not reproducible (while the error is reproducible).

As we use square brackets throughout the system this is a bigger issue for us.

Thank you for looking into this.
Mel
fields.summary: Anchor cannot be used when page name contains square brackets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-42981].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to replicate :
 # Install Confluence 5.10 and JIRA 7.0.9 core (Issue can be replicated with JIRA software 7.0.1 as well)
 # Integrate Confluence with JIRA
 # Create JIRA project named jiratest with the project key JIR
 # Create a JIRA issue in that project
 # Login to Confluence 5.10 and create a new Space
 # In the new Space create a new a page named test jira
 # Insert a JIRA macro for JIR-1 and set to show the following column only in the display options :
 Summary, Created, Updated, Due Date, Reporter, Priority, Status, Resolution
 # Insert another JIRA macro for JIR-1 and set to show the following column only in the display options :
 Issue Type, Created, Updated, Assignee

*Existing behavior* : Both JIRA macro is showing the exact column that is being set by the first JIRA macro created on the page as you can see from the screenshot below :
 !testJiraMacro.jpg|thumbnail!
 You can also see that the second JIRA macro shown have the following columns :
 !testJiraMacro2.jpg|thumbnail!
 *Expected behavior* : Both JIRA macro should show the appropriate columns configured.
h3. Workaround

Click edit on the page then click edit on the JIRA macro that is showing the wrong column. From there insert the JIRA macro back to the page and the issue should be resolved.

*Please note that this issue will occur on existing pages if Confluence is being upgraded from earlier version to Confluence 5.10*

h3. Resolution
Thanks again for your patience everyone. We have now released fixed versions of JIRA Macros to the Marketplace. JIRA Macros version 6.0.12 is compatible with Confluence 5.10.x, and JIRA Macros version 7.1.4 is compatible with Confluence version 6.0.x. 

You can update JIRA Macros by going to Admin > Manage Add ons, and the update will be available for all compatible versions there.

If the update is not listed and you are on Confluence 5.9 or below, you will need to upgrade Confluence to get this fix.

The fixed version will be bundled in Confluence 6.0.2, so no action needs to be taken if you are using 6.0.2 or above.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro is repeated when adding 2 JIRA Issue Macro from the same issue key

fields.description:
Add a configurable 'time to survive after split brain' parameter for clusters. This will be used to pause the cluster safety job if a likely split brain is detected, ie if the cluster safety job has run on this instance before (meaning it's not the first run after startup), but the cluster safety number cannot be found in the cache. 

In this scenario, the cluster safety job will wait for the configured time-to-survive, to allow the nodes to rejoin. After this time has passed, if the node still cannot find the cluster safety number in the cache, the node will panic.
fields.summary: Add time to survive timeout to cluster safety job

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a Confluence administrator, I would like to have additional sorting options in the Page Tree Macro that allow more flexibility while sorting. Things to consider:

h3. Suggested Solution
Current options are:

bitwise — sort alphabetically, for example: title1, title10, title2.
creation — sort by date of creation.
modified — sort by order of date last modified.
natural — sort in 'natural' alphabetical order, for example: title1, title2, title10.
position — sort by the default Confluence sorting rules. If your pages have been ordered manually, this sort will respect the defined order. Otherwise the pages will be displayed in the 'natural' alphabetical order, such as: title1, title2, title10.

Things to consider: 
# Allow to sort/filter by labels
# Add some filtering options to the macro
fields.summary: As a Confluence administrator, I would like to have additional sorting options in the Page Tree Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-42945].
  {panel}

h2. Steps to reproduce
# On a given page, add a comment including an image
# Add a second comment with a unrelated image, but with the same filename

h2. Expected behavior
The original comment will reference the original image, while the new comment displays the new image

h2. Actual behavior
Because both images have the same filename, Confluence creates a new version of the original image. As a result, both new and old comments now display the new image, thereby losing the attachment's context.

h2. Additional notes
* This is also true of attachments uploaded via any other mechanism (Page Editor, drag and drop, More Actions > Attachments, etc)
* This behavior is not restricted to images. All attachments will behave this way
* This is common for filenames that are generic, e.g. "logo.png" or "screenshot.jpg"

h2. Propose solutions
* *Proposal 1*: In comments, specifically refer to attachments by their specific version, rather than always the latest version
* *Proposal 2*: Warn the user during upload if an attachment filename already exists on the page. We can additionally offer an option to rename the file or to continue and create a new version of the existing file
fields.summary: When attachments of the same name are uploaded, all page references automatically show latest version

Charts that worked fine now are not displayed with the error mentioned above, every time the column name has special characters in it, for example "Mês" (month in portuguese). Another thing I've noticed is that the chart is rendered in the preview mode of editing a page but it fails to render when saved / published. This stopped working in Confluence 5.9.7. It is possible to reproduce this issue in Confluence without SQL macro by doing the following: 1. Add the Chart macro to a page 2. Add an HTML macro inside the Chart macro 3. MêsVâlor
163
286
395
498
{code} Save the page

fields.description:
This bug report relates to warnings logged by the [Database Constraint Checker|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/The+Database+Constraint+Checker] which was introduced in Confluence 5.7. 

h3. Cause
This particular warning occurs because there is a column in the database which should allow null values, but does not according to the check it shouldn't. The upgrade to 5.10 included a task to change those columns to allow non-null but the checker was not updated

This warning has been encountered on these columns:

* spaces.lowerspacekey
* extrnlnks.lowerurl
* trackbacklinks.lowerurl

These warnings appear in the logs:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
2016-06-18 19:22:55,489 WARN [AtlassianEvent::CustomizableThreadFactory-1] [core.persistence.schema.StartupSchemaChecker] handleWarnings Database schema is inconsistent with expectations. 3 potential issues found, see below for details.
2016-06-18 19:22:55,489 WARN [AtlassianEvent::CustomizableThreadFactory-1] [core.persistence.schema.StartupSchemaChecker] handleWarnings Column [lowerspacekey] of table [spaces] has mismatched definitions for expected [Column spaces.lowerspacekey varchar(255) nullable] and actual [Column spaces.lowerspacekey varchar(255) non-nullable]

fields.description:
I've installed confluence by using the docker container. For some reason firefox doesn't send an {{Origin}} HTTP header when invoking {{POST /rest/webResources/1.0/resources}}.

Even when I try to add this header manually and resend the request, firefox is filtering this header, which results in a 403 response from the confluence server.

Versions:
* Docker 1.11.2
* Confluence 5.10.0 (https://hub.docker.com/r/atlassian/confluence-server)
* Firefox 47.0

I'm actually not sure if this is an CORS or a XSRF problem. I've found [this kb article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/creating-a-page-in-firefox-causes-the-create-dialog-to-wait-indefinitely-790791437.html], which matches the behavior of my confluence installation, but there is no {{<meta name="referrer" content="none">}} entry to remove, so it doesn't help.
fields.summary: Confluence + Docker + Firefox = not usable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-42924].
  {panel}

Hi,

I have a job that exports a documentation space as PDF. The instance is: https://snpseq.atlassian.net/wiki/

This is major, since we use it to export the documentation in our build/deployment pipeline.

I'm using the SOAP API, in particular the `exportSpace` method, documented [here|https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/deprecated-apis/remote-api-specification-for-pdf-export#RemoteAPISpecificationforPDFExport-SOAPInformation]:

Recently, this started failing regularly with the error: *504, Gateway time-out.*

Details:
* I'm using the SOAP API through a Python library called suds.
* If it helps, the exact code I'm running is available [here|https://github.com/withrocks/confluence-tools/blob/master/confluence_tools/main.py#L85] on my github account.
fields.summary: Getting time-out while exporting a space via the SOAP api

fields.description:
A test that used to work until Confluence version 5.9.x and below, now stopped working in Confluence 5.10.x because some Confluence  internal template is using deprecated code, which is completely unrelated to our add-on, and apparently it fails when running Confluence on dev mode. Unfortunately integrated test are run in development mode :-)

This is the error:
{code}
java.lang.RuntimeException: Error rendering template for decorator root
    at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.velocity.ApplyDecoratorDirective.render(ApplyDecoratorDirective.java:162)
caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Error rendering template for decorator page
    at com.atlassian.confluence.setup.velocity.ApplyDecoratorDirective.render(ApplyDecoratorDirective.java:162)
caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: (This exception is only thrown when dev.mode is enabled) Velocity template accessing deprecated method com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Page#getOriginalVersion - /decorators/includes/link-to-this-page.vm[line 7, column 114]
    at com.atlassian.confluence.velocity.introspection.AnnotationBoxingUberspect.logOrThrowDeprecationWarningsIfNecessary(AnnotationBoxingUberspect.java:187)
{code}
fields.summary: Deprecate Confluence internal code cause integration tests to fail
Textsearch in documents

fields.description:
The create page from template macro has a title parameter. 

When used to create blueprints like file list or how to articles, the title field is not pre-populated.

It looks like only page templates not blueprints honour this macro's property.
fields.summary: Create page from template macro title parameter is ignored by most blueprints
Update documentation to accurately describe the inability to configure Office Connector add-on

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-42916].
  {panel}

I have two global templates:
  1) <project template> a parent object
  2) Discovery template...

As seen here:
template.png

I want to have on the parent template a macro button to via create from template call discovery template... but when I try to embed this "Create from Template" macro I get this issue:
 image-2016-06-16-12-26-47-191.png

Thanks... for anything that allows templates to use other templates.
fields.summary: Ability for Confluence Template to called other template via embed other macro "Create from template"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-42915].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Users would like to swap the rows and columns in the JIRA issues macro.

h3. Suggested Solution
Include the functionality to set the column as the header.
fields.summary: Allow using column for headers in JIRA Issues Macro

fields.description:
While editing a Confluence page using either IE 11 or IE 10, put your cursor halfway down the page and try adding an emoticon. See that it resets the cursor to the top of the page and puts the emoticon up there as well. 

Additionally, highlight text and select the bold option, again the cursor will reset to the top of the page.

Can only reproduce using IE. On Confluence version 5.9.8

Looks like CONF-31613 was a similar issue that says it's resolved, but I'm still seeing the issue
fields.summary: Cursor resetting to top of page in edit mode

fields.description:
Hello,
I try to migrate from confluence 5.8 to Confluence 5.10 :
 I backed up the data folder ( home folder ) and create a dump of the Mysql data base.
On a test environment I installed the new confluence version and and make it point to the data restored from old confluence version and old database backup.
But I can not pass the health check  at start up : I am notified that some tables of my schema don't have the appropriate default collation ( utf8_bin)
I ran a procedure to change the database collation and all tables collation.
It seems every thing 's ok ....but still the problem.
I change the log level to DEBUG.....: every thing 's ok but comes this fatal error because of the collation of some tables. ( even if all tables are ok )
I dont understand why the health check is not successfull now although I ran a procedure that changes all tables collation and charset ( see the procedure  attached )

Can I bypass this check ?

Regards.

Chrisotphe
fields.summary: Confluence Healt Check : collation problem after backup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-42900].
  {panel}

Currently the styling customizations in Confluence (under Confluence Admin > Look and Feel) do not apply to exports done at the page level:
* More Actions > Export to Word
* More Actions > Export to PDF

This includes "PDF Stylesheets" and "PDF Layout" customizations, which only apply to space-level PDF exports.

This feature request is to add customization options for single-page exports.

h4. Use case
A use case for this came from a support ticket, where a customer would like to add a message in every page export (e.g. "For Internal Use Only"). The customer was able to add a global stylesheet to make such a message appear on every page when viewed in the browser, but this customization would be ignored during a page export since only the content of the page is exported.
fields.summary: Provide ability to customize single-page PDF and Word exports

fields.description:
During setup of self hosted, there are a couple times where the system appears to "hang" because it is processing data (e.g. creating db, restoring content, etc.). This is normally not an issue.. just sit it out and wait. We know it's processing. The issue comes into play when you use a proxy in front of it such as nginx. nginx views that as a timeout with default settings. This timeout breaks the process in the middle of it and corrupts the install. A simple fix would be to not use nginx, but I like using https when sending my password for my database over the internet and I don't like opening up non-web ports on my firewall. Additionally.. you could also be like me and have it take 4 hours for you to realize it's not a you problem, but rather a configuration problem. I view this as a bug, but you might consider it a feature request.. I'll leave that up to you.. but you should really treat the process differently than you are and just have the page dynamically update with the progress instead of just letting it "process" in a way that something can view as the web page going unresponsive.

Steps to reproduce:
1. install/set up nginx as proxy for confluence port
2. install confluence
3. configure confluence
4. wait for timeout and refresh.. you'll get a 500 stack trace of a java thread
fields.summary: Timeouts During Setup

fields.description:
I recently upgraded our confluence on-premise instance 5.6.4 to 5.9.11. I noticed now that the anchor links in the Table of Contents macro no longer work for existing or new pages. This was thought to be resolved by switching from the "Documentation" theme to the "Default" theme but I have been able to reproduce this issue ([https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-39960]) while already being in the "Default" theme.

The work around is to use Table of Contents zone
If you "Open in new tab/window" the link will properly work however it does not render properly within the same window/tab.
fields.summary: Table of Contents macro no longer works after upgrade to 5.9.11

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-42864].
  {panel}

h5. Problem statement
Currently, page restrictions only allow you to define a set of users and groups that _can_ view or edit a page.

h5. Suggested solution
Sometimes an administrator or page owner wants to set the page restrictions of a page in Confluence to be viewable/editable by all users in Confluence except for a select few.

In that scenario, it is practically far, much easier if there is a "blocked" permission as well, where the administrator or page owner can straight away define the set of users who *don't have permission* to view/edit the page.

h5. Example
I want to set the page restrictions for Page A whereby only 95 out of 100 users in Confluence can view the page.

All 95 users are scattered across different groups and do not belong in a single common group. It is impractical to individually list out all 95 users, compared to listing the 5 users who can't view the page.
fields.summary: Allow page restrictions to let you list users who can't view/edit pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-42863].
  {panel}

h5. Summary
Jira Issues Macro is not displaying custom date fields in the user time zone (Confluence), but rather the server time zone (Confluence)

h5. Environment
Confluence with applink to Jira

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# In Jira, create a ticket with a custom date field and a custom date time field.
# Set the Jira user time zone to be different to the server time zone so that the custom fields display a different date.
# In Confluence, create a page with this issue and set the display option to table format with the custom fields.
# Set the Confluence user time zone to be the same as the Jira user time zone (assuming Confluence Server time zone is same as Jira).

h5. Expected Results
Custom date and date time fields in Jira and Confluence display the same date and time.

h5. Actual Results
Custom date and date time fields in Jira is displayed correctly according to user time zone settings while Confluence displays custom date and date time fields in Confluence Server time zone.
Custom date time fields can also be truncated to just the date and show the wrong date (in server time zone)

h5. Notes
This behaviour is seen on both cloud and confluence server.
Jira rest endpoint is returning the custom date and custom date time fields in Jira user time zone eg {{<customfieldvalue>Wed, 20 Jul 2016 18:48:00 +0200</customfieldvalue>}}, JIM macro is incorrectly transforming this to Confluence server time zone instead of Confluence user time zone.

h5. Workaround
none so far
fields.summary: Jira Issues Macro is not displaying custom date fields in the user time zone

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A link of the profile in All Update is not updated, after updating username via Crowd.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.8.x
* Confluence 5.9.10
* Confluence 5.10.0
* User management uses JIRA/CROWD

h3. Steps to Reproduce

user1: test1 in JIRA
user2: admin ... Confluence Admin and JIRA admin

1. Login Confluence as test1
2. Edit profile and Save
3. Go Top Page and watch All Update 
     profile updated link is http://localhost:8090/~test1

4. Login JIRA as admin
5. Go User Management
6. Press Edit link of the user(test1)
7. Change Username from test1 to test123
8. Press Update

9. Back to Confluence
10. Login Confluence as Admin
11. Go Confluence Admin
12. Go User Directory
13. Perform Synchronise link in JIRA Server area

14. Go to Top page of Confluence
       The URL of "Profile updated ..." is not updated.
       The link is still http://localhost:8090/~test1 not http://localhost:8090/~test123
15. Click the link, "Page not found" is displayed.


h3. Expected Results

when a username is changed, the link of the username is also updated. 

h3. Actual Results

when a username is changed, but the link of the username is not updated.

h3.Workaround
Confluence administration
 -> Content Indexing
 Perform Rebuild
fields.summary: A link of the profile in All Update is not updated, after updating username via Crowd

fields.description:
If you use only GoEdit add-on without "Arsenale Lockpoint" for managing attachments, the following buttons disappear:  'Delete' and 'Properties" and in addition, when you make changes in an attachments and save it, you cannot add a comment describing the changes. 
The only way for adding comments is by using 'Properties' button.
Only when you enable Arsenale Lockpoint, you get the "Delete' and 'Properties' buttons, which are buttons of Confluence. Even when you use both add-ons, you still dfont have the ability to add reasons for change when you save a new version (using Properties is wrong methodology, as you may save changes without any documentation.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users without 'Can Use' permissions are allowed to be @mentioned in Confluence 5.8.15 so they will be notificated when mentioned. They can't disable Email Notification in their profile settings since they are not allowed to access the application.

h3. Environment
JIRA connected to AD and then Confluence connected to JIRA

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Integrate JIRA with the AD
# Add the 'jira-users' to all AD's users
# Integrate Confluence with JIRA and synchronize the directory(all users will be retrieved)
# Try to mention users that are not allowed to access the application

h3. Expected Results
The search is not able to find the users that should not have access to the application

h3. Actual Results
Users are mentioned and will receive email notifications
 
h3. Notes
Doesn't happen in Confluence 5.10. (!) Need more tests

h3.Workaround
No workaround yet

fields.description:
Hi - in edit mode, I can link a "bar" in a roadmap to a page - nice!

However, in display mode (ie, not in edit mode) the "link page" link shows, implying that I can create a link from the bar to a page. Clicking the link even allows me to search for a page, but then the page choice doesn't stick. For existing links to pages, the edit pencil shows, implying that I can change the existing link - but same deal - the edit doesn't stick.

Interestingly, the Create Page link works in non-edit mode; ie, I can click Create Page and create a new page which is then linked to the bar.
fields.summary: Roadmap Planner link to page function is a little wonky
Display labels in Page Properties Report macro output

fields.description:
During setup of self hosted, there are a couple times where the system appears to "hang" because it is processing data (e.g. creating db, restoring content, etc.). This is normally not an issue.. just sit it out and wait. We know it's processing. The issue comes into play when you use a proxy in front of it such as nginx. nginx views that as a timeout with default settings. This timeout breaks the process in the middle of it and corrupts the install. A simple fix would be to not use nginx, but I like using https when sending my password for my database over the internet and I don't like opening up non-web ports on my firewall. Additionally.. you could also be like me and have it take 4 hours for you to realize it's not a you problem, but rather a configuration problem. I view this as a bug, but you might consider it a feature request.. I'll leave that up to you.. but you should really treat the process differently than you are and just have the page dynamically update with the progress instead of just letting it "process" in a way that something can view as the web page going unresponsive.

Steps to reproduce:
1. install/set up nginx as proxy for confluence port
2. install confluence
3. configure confluence
4. wait for timeout and refresh.. you'll get a 500 stack trace of a java thread
fields.summary: Timeouts During Setup

fields.description:
I believe this is a flawed logic in the application where you will be forced to create a space before the user(admin in this case) is able to access Confluence.

Steps to reproduce :
# Install Confluence 5.4.3
# Upgrade to Confluence 5.9.12
# Login to Confluence as confluence administrator
# The welcome screen will be present that force the user to create a space even though the upgraded Confluence instances already contains spaces :
!onboarding.jpg|thumbnail!

Existing behavior : the welcome screen forces the user(admin in this case) to create a space

Expected behavior : the space creation portion should be omitted at least for upgraded instances.
fields.summary: Flawed onboarding (welcome message) when upgrading Confluence from earlier version (5.7 and below) to newer version

fields.description:
1) create 31 pages with a page property macro and label "test".
2) create page with page properties report and label "test", set "number of items to display" to 50
3) all pages were displayed on the report table
4) add a task report to one page property
5) the property report will now split in two pages. Although number of items to display is still 50, it will be broken at the 30th entry.

Similar to use a JIRA macro on page property (CONF-41462). Maybe the same problem technically?
fields.summary: "Number of items to display" will not respected in page properties report if there is a task report in page property table

fields.description:
Table of Contents links are not consistently working.

When you click on one, it will change the URL, but not move to that section of the confluence page.

Copying and pasting the link to another browser window does take  you to the correct page section.

This is NOT true of all our pages that include tables of contents.

In response to [this report|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/97547/table-of-contents-links-not-working-when-included-using-include-page-macro], my customer reports: his page doesn't use the "include-page" macro, but it does have the "excerpt-include" and the "children display" macros.

Work-around: encapsulate the Table of Contents macro inside a Table of Contents Zone.

But that's not intuitive.
fields.summary: TOC links don't take you to that section in the page

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce
# Install a blueprint plugin containing templates
# Click the "Create" button to populate the template listing
# Go to Confluence Admin > Global Templates and Blueprints and modify a template from the blueprint
# Install a newer version of the blueprint plugin with some templates added or removed
# Click the "Create" button and observe the template listing

h2. Expected behavior
* New templates from the updated blueprint plugin are added to the Create dialog
* Templates removed from the updated blueprint plugin are removed from the Create dialog
* Templates that have not changed in the updated blueprint plugin, but was previously modified in the UI should keep their modifications
* Templates that have changed with the updated blueprint plugin, and was also previously modified in the UI should be "reset" to the new default template provided by the plugin, OR continue to be overridden by modifications

h2. Actual behavior
In the Create dialog, none of the templates actually reflect the templates packaged with the updated blueprint plugin. To the user, it effectively appears as if the blueprint was never updated

h2. Technical details
This issue concerns the following three tables:
* *AO_54C900_CONTENT_BLUEPRINT_AO* - where the blueprint metadata is stored
* *AO_54C900_C_TEMPLATE_REF* - where the template references are stored
* *pagetemplates* - where the actual contents of any modified templates are stored

When a blueprint plugin is installed, and the user opens the Create dialog the following occurs:
* A row is added to "AO_54C900_CONTENT_BLUEPRINT_AO" with the "PLUGIN_CLONE" set to "t". This indicates that none of the blueprint's templates have been modified from the defaults.
* Similarly, "AO_54C900_C_TEMPLATE_REF" stores all of the template references, and is tied to the first table via the "CB_INDEX_PARENTID" and "CB_PARENTID" columns. All of the "TEMPLATE_ID" values are set to "0", which indicates they have not been modified from the default.

When a template is modified, the following occurs:
* "AO_54C900_CONTENT_BLUEPRINT_AO" creates a new row, with "PLUGIN_CLONE" set to "f" indicating that one or more of its templates have deviated from the default
* "AO_54C900_C_TEMPLATE_REF" creates a new set of templates (on top of the existing set), each referencing the new ID of the new row in the first table. The modified template also has a non-zero "TEMPLATE_ID" value
* Rows are added to the "pagetemplates" containing the modified template contents, while referencing to the previous table by "template_id" as well as "prevver".
* The Create dialog now displays the modified template listing associated with the "AO_54C900_CONTENT_BLUEPRINT_AO" whose "PLUGIN_CLONE" value is "f"

Finally, when a new version of the blueprint plugin is subsequently updated, the following occurs:
* "AO_54C900_CONTENT_BLUEPRINT_AO" remains unchanged
* "AO_54C900_C_TEMPLATE_REF" updates its template listing, now referencing the unmodified blueprint ("PLUGIN_CLONE" = "t") in the first table. All of the entries referencing the modified blueprint ("PLUGIN_CLONE" = "f") remains unchanged
* The Create dialog continues to show all the templates associated with the "modified" blueprint, effectively ignoring all of the changes from the new blueprint update

h4. Proposed solution
The blueprint plugin update should correctly update the "AO_54C900_C_TEMPLATE_REF" template references to point to the modified blueprint, as well as retain any template modifications (assuming the template themselves have not changed between versions)

h2. Workaround
* Back up (if desired) and remove all template customizations for that blueprint via SQL (see below) in order for the templates from the new blueprint to show up.
* Add the customizations back in afterwards, as needed

h4. SQL to remove blueprint template customizations
(!) *Backup your database prior to running the below. It is also recommended to run this on your test environment first*
In all queries below, "my.blueprint.plugin.key" is a placeholder and should be substituted with your actual blueprint plugin key.
{code:sql}
DELETE FROM pagetemplates
WHERE prevver IN (
  SELECT "TEMPLATE_ID" FROM "AO_54C900_C_TEMPLATE_REF"
  WHERE "PLUGIN_MODULE_KEY" LIKE 'my.blueprint.plugin.key%'
    AND "TEMPLATE_ID" != 0)
OR templateid IN (
  SELECT "TEMPLATE_ID" FROM "AO_54C900_C_TEMPLATE_REF"
  WHERE "PLUGIN_MODULE_KEY" LIKE 'my.blueprint.plugin.key%'
    AND "TEMPLATE_ID" != 0);
{code}
{code:sql}
DELETE FROM "AO_54C900_C_TEMPLATE_REF"
WHERE "CB_INDEX_PARENTID" IN (
  SELECT "ID"
  FROM "AO_54C900_CONTENT_BLUEPRINT_AO"
  WHERE "PLUGIN_MODULE_KEY" LIKE 'my.blueprint.plugin.key%'
    AND "PLUGIN_CLONE" = 'f')
OR "CB_PARENTID" IN (
  SELECT "ID"
  FROM "AO_54C900_CONTENT_BLUEPRINT_AO"
  WHERE "PLUGIN_MODULE_KEY" LIKE 'my.blueprint.plugin.key%'
    AND "PLUGIN_CLONE" = 'f');
{code}
{code:sql}
DELETE FROM "AO_54C900_CONTENT_BLUEPRINT_AO"
WHERE "PLUGIN_MODULE_KEY" LIKE 'my.blueprint.plugin.key%'
  AND "PLUGIN_CLONE" = 'f';
{code}
fields.summary: After updating blueprints, template listing still shows old templates if a template was previously modified

fields.description:
We have users who are in the directory (Our confluence is pointing to our jira server, which is using Active directory) But are not licensed for Confluence. (ie they are not in a group that has "can use" rights) But we do have anonymous access turned on.

Those users can be @mentioned in pages. When they are, they will get email notifications.

They can't log in to disable those emails, and as an admin I can't control it either.

Should an unlicensed user be able to get emails from the system? 

I possible could try "disabling" them, but unless you have a bulk disable feature, this is going to be very time consuming. (10 licensed users, 500 in directory)
fields.summary: Users who are not licensed still receive emails from @mentions

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Rendering Javascript from an HTML macro in a Confluence page breaks the edit functionality

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.9.4
* Chrome, Firefox, Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a space with the default theme:
# Enable the HTML macros
# Add the following code inside of the macro
{code}
<!-- TradingView Widget BEGIN -->
<script type="text/javascript" src="https://s3.amazonaws.com/tradingview/tv.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript">
new TradingView.widget(
{ "width": 862, "height": 250, "symbol": "NASDAQ:TEAM", "interval": "D", "toolbar_bg": "#E4E8EB", "hide_top_toolbar": true, "allow_symbol_change": true, "save_image": false }
);
</script>
<!-- TradingView Widget END -->
{code}
# Save the page
# Edit the page 

You can also try the following, which breaks the editor in a different way:
{code}
<script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.11.3/jquery.min.js">
</script>
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Page is editable and you can change the code within the macros

h3. Actual Results
Instead of taking you to the editor, Confluence displays the same URL to view the page, and it shows the JavaScript macro in a page. You cannot edit the page this way.

h3. Thing I've tried

Place the code in an HTML macro within the 'Excerpt' macro in another page, then include this excerpt in your target page. This still breaks the editor.

Place the JS code in a user macro, then add that user macro to a page. This breaks the editor too.

h3. Workaround

* Use the Documentation theme. However, this is deprecated currently in Confluence. 
* You can also access the edit view for that page directly: http://baseURL/pages/editpage.action?pageId=<ID OF THE PAGE>
fields.summary: Rendering Javascript from an HTML macro in a Confluence page breaks the edit functionality
Suppress batch notification if user already notified of @mention/task

fields.description:
We have a button in the editor panel described in atlassian-plugin.xml:

<web-item key="cipe-docs" section="system.editor.savebar.buttons.secondary">
       <label key="docs.label"/>
       <tooltip key="docs.tooltip"/>
       <link linkId="cipe-docs-link"/>
       <condition class="com.stiltsoft.confluence.extra.cipe.conditions.EditWithInPlaceEditorCondition"/>
       <param name="iconClass">aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-info</param>
   </web-item>

but the icon on the button is broken. We see something like this in the page code:

<span class="iconaui-icon-small aui-iconfont-info">,

but we expect a space between classes:

<span class="icon aui-icon-small aui-iconfont-info">
fields.summary: Custom style classes that described using iconClass parameter aren't separated by space from the Confluence classes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-42820].
  {panel}

In Confluence there are currently two ways to connect to the database:
* Via a Direct JDBC connection, wherein the connection config is set in <confluence_home>/confluence.cfg.xml and the connection pooling is managed by c3p0
* Via a Tomcat Datasource, where the connection config are set in <confluence_install>/conf/server.xml, and the connection pooling is managed by Tomcat

While this gives the customer more flexibility, it also adds additional complexity during setup and upgrades. This choice has been in Confluence as far back as I can remember, but are we adding any value by having both? For example, the Tomcat Datasource seems to do a decent job and is [well-dcoumented|https://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-8.0-doc/jndi-resources-howto.html]. Would the product be easier to maintain (for customers and for us) in the long run in just having the Tomcat Datasource as the sole option? (We can also further simplify the process by having the server.xml content be populated from the UI instead of having to manually edit the file.)

For what it's worth, customers have encountered several bugs with c3p0 in the past, some of which forced them to move to a Tomcat Datasource as a workaround anyway:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-36484
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-33514
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-25531
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-42685

I realize I may be missing some key reasons for having both options (in which case please close this issue), but I wanted to bring this up in case it's one of those things that's only in the product because of legacy reasons that are now obsolete.
fields.summary: Evaluate how we can simplify database setup

fields.description:
Hi Team

We have encountered an issue with the Colour Scheme which we use for our product Enterprise Theme.
The issue is that the Colour Scheme is not applied to the menu items in the Top Bar Menu dropdown.
You can easily reproduce this the following way:
# Change in the Confluence Admin - Custom Colour Scheme the following two options: 
## Menu Item Selected Background
## Menu Item Selected Text
# Save the Custom Colour Scheme
# Hover over the General configuration (Confluence Administration)
 
You will get the same colours as in the default colour scheme but you expect the colours to have changed.
I attach an example. The working version was done in Confluence 5.9.12. 

*Confluence 5.9.12 is correct*
 !Screen Shot 2016-06-08 at 10.06.40.png|thumbnail! 

*Confluence 5.10 is incorrect*
 !Screen Shot 2016-06-08 at 09.49.39.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Colour Scheme not applied to Menu Item selected
